just a moment
what is the brand and model number of your computer?
are you on ubuntu 9.10?
was it a new install or an upgrade? and did it not work initially?
did you install the proprietary Broadcom STA Driver through the ubuntu utility?
were you prompted to install the driver?
connect using the ethernet cable, go to System > Administration > Hardware drivers and pick the Broadcom STA wireless driver and activate it. then restart and your wireless should work.
intel wireless cards contain chips in them. these chips can be broadcom.
since the actual manufacturer of the card usually doesn't matter, people distinguish wireless cards with the manufacturer of the chips
how did you determine that?

you can get a launchpad account and click on "Subscribe/Unsubscribe" to be notified for changes in that bug.
